**The Sword of Kas** is an [intelligent](/wiki/Intelligent "Intelligent") [artifact weapon](/wiki/Artifact_weapon "Artifact weapon") that appears in [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"). It is [chaotic](/wiki/Chaotic "Chaotic")-aligned, and its [base item](/wiki/Base_item "Base item") is a [two-handed sword](/wiki/Two-handed_sword "Two-handed sword") made of [gemstone](/wiki/Gemstone "Gemstone").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)
- [2 Description](#Description)
- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [4 History](#History)
- [5 Origin](#Origin)
- [6 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)
- [7 References](#References)

## Generation

The Sword of Kas [is always generated](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") in the possession of [Kas](/wiki/Kas "Kas") within [Vecna's Domain](/wiki/Vecna%27s_Domain "Vecna's Domain"). It cannot be [wished](/wiki/Wish "Wish") for; if left in bones, it will revert to a 'mundane' gemstone two-handed sword.

Due to its generation method, it does not increase the [artifact](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact") count for purposes of [wishing](/wiki/Wish "Wish").

## Description

The Sword of Kas has +1d10 [to-hit](/wiki/To-hit "To-hit") and is permanently coated in [poison](/wiki/Poison "Poison"), dealing extra poison damage against monsters without [poison resistance](/wiki/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance"); it also deals double damage versus [cross-aligned](/wiki/Cross-aligned "Cross-aligned") monsters and [liches](/wiki/Lich_\(monster_class\) "Lich (monster class)"), and will deal three times the damage when used specifically against [Vecna](/wiki/Vecna "Vecna"). While wielded, it grants [stoning resistance](/wiki/Stoning_resistance "Stoning resistance") and sets the wielder's [strength](/wiki/Strength "Strength") to 25 - it is additionally [bloodthirsty](/wiki/Bloodthirsty "Bloodthirsty") similar to [Stormbringer](/wiki/Stormbringer "Stormbringer"), meaning that you will attack any monster you walk into while wielding it.

## Strategy

The Sword of Kas is often a vital part of most players' kits for dealing with Vecna - keep in mind that [lawful](/wiki/Lawful "Lawful") characters take alignment penalties for using poisoned weapons, while [Priests](/wiki/Priest "Priest") of any kind suffer a -30 to-hit penalty from trying to use it on top of potentially [angering](/wiki/Anger "Anger") their [god](/wiki/God "God").

A character capable of defeating Kas is one that has *usually* completed their quest - in the event you are lawful and have not yet done so, it is usually best to refrain from wielding the Sword on anything more than a very-sparingly basis.

## History

The Sword of Kas first appears in EvilHack 0.7.0, where it is added alongside Kas as part of the second of three commits related to Vecna's Domain.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)

## Origin

[![Wikipedia](/images/thumb/f/f8/Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png/50px-Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png)](/wiki/File:Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png "Wikipedia")

[Wikipedia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page "wikipedia:Main Page") has an article about:

***[Kas the Bloody-Handed](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kas_the_Bloody-Handed "wikipedia:Kas the Bloody-Handed")***

In the Greyhawk setting of *[Dungeons & Dragons](/wiki/Dungeons_%26_Dragons "Dungeons & Dragons")*, the Sword of Kas was given by Vecna to his then-right-hand-man and most trusted lieutenant, Kas the Bloody-Handed; Kas would later turn against Vecna and (temporarily) destroy him using the sword. As details of Kas's service and subsequent betrayal vary with the edition, so too do the origins of the sword: In the 1st edition's *Dungeon Master's Guide*, Vecna only procured the sword for his chief lieutenant; one telling in much later editions has Vecna creating the Sword of Kas himself and imbuing it with a "portion of his consciousness". As alluded to by the [encyclopedia](/wiki/Encyclopedia "Encyclopedia") entry, some sources indicate that Kas may have been goaded into betrayal by the whispers of the Sword itself.

Regardless, the Sword is is consistently tied to Vecna and his other relics, specifically [Vecna's hand](/wiki/The_Hand_of_Vecna_\(EvilHack\) "The Hand of Vecna (EvilHack)") [and his eye](/wiki/The_Eye_of_Vecna "The Eye of Vecna"). Both relics and the Sword were the only remaining objects in the area after their fight, with Vecna destroyed for the time being and Kas being flung across many Planes by the resulting destruction. Its appearance, properties and hit dice have also varied between editions - the Sword as it appears in EvilHack is something of an amalgamation (e.g., the 25 strength comes from the +10 strength bonus it granted to the wielder in 3rd Edition).[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)[\[5\]](#cite_note-5)

## Encyclopedia entry

Kas and the Sword share the same encyclopedia entry:

Kas the Bloody-Handed was the most trusted lieutenant of the  
despotic lich Vecna, and wielder of the Sword of Kas.  
  
After many years of loyal service to Vecna, Kas eventually  
betrayed his master. It is said that the sword itself whispered  
to Kas, convincing him to slay his master and usurp his power.
